extra.json.description: For supplementary details.  It records the parameter estimation method, and the intrinsic covariance matrix calculation method.  Study the text of statsmodels.tsa.arima.model.ARIMA.fit.

data.csv.timestamp: The timestamp of a measurement,  milliseconds since 1 January 1970.
data.csv.value: The water level above a fixed measuring point, i.e., above the station Gauge Datum, in metres.
data.csv.ts_id: The water level time series identification code.
data.csv.measure: The sum of value and a gauge's gauge datum.  The unit of measure of each is metres.

testing.csv.timestamp: The timestamp of a measurement,  milliseconds since 1 January 1970.
testing.csv.value: The water level above a fixed measuring point, i.e., above the station Gauge Datum, in metres.
testing.csv.ts_id: The water level time series identification code.
testing.csv.measure: The sum of value and a gauge's gauge datum.  The unit of measure of each is metres.

training.csv.value: The water level above a fixed measuring point, i.e., above the station Gauge Datum, in metres.
training.csv.ts_id: The water level time series identification code.
training.csv.measure: The sum of value and a gauge's gauge datum.  The unit of measure of each is metres.

estimates.csv.lower_q: The lower quartile of a measurement's estimates.
estimates.csv.upper_q: The upper quartile of a measurement's estimates.
estimates.csv.lower_w: The lower whisker of a measurement's estimates.
estimates.csv.upper_w: The upper whisker of a measurement's estimates.
estimates.csv.milliseconds: The timestamp of the original measurement, milliseconds since 1 January 1970.

evidence_lower_bound.csv.index: The ordinal index of an evidence bound value.
